scenario_text.value: We might be heading home soon.

It doesn’t seem real. I had been so focused
on wondering when I would die...

First things first, Saki. We still don’t know
if we can even beat Piemon.

Sorry. You’re right. But it’s important to
try and stay positive, right?

To imagine what we’ll do once we get home...
That helps me feel braver when I need to.

That’s definitely better than just being
depressed.

I hope we can all be together when we’re
home. Agumon and Floramon and everyone.

But I might not be able to join you right
away...
Huh? Why not?

It’s normal, right! I have things to do,
people to see!

(Things to do? That’s weird...
Maybe I should ask what she means.)

(We’re better friends than we were before,
but a personal question...)
(How do I respond to Saki?)
What do you mean?
Whenever is fine.
That’s too bad.
What do you mean?
You have secret things to do?
You know, things! Why are you prying?
Things. Just...things. Right?

(Huh? Does that mean that Floramon knows what
Saki is talking about?)
Whenever is fine.

It doesn’t have to be right away.
Whenever works for you.
Takuma...

We got through this craziness together, so
we’ll be friends even if you can’t join us.
That’s true... Thanks.

So I’ll see you when I see you, then.
Your treat, right?
Until then...
Hang on! I didn’t say I’d treat you!

Don’t be such a tightwad!
I’m looking forward to it!
That’s too bad.

Well, that’s sad. After all, we’ve gotten to
know each other so much better...

It’s not that Saki doesn’t want to see you.
It’s just that she has things to do.

I’ll let you know if we decide to get
together, okay?

We gotta get down to business first, if we’re
gonna make it back home.

(Oh yeah, I wonder if the professor’s feeling
any better?)
(I should go <color=#B41919>check on him</color>.)
